result.execSummary:
The defendant Brad F Heikkinen was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Brad F Heikkinen is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Brad F Heikkinen was found guilty of 2nd-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety [Modifiers: Repeater], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.30(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: to any sentence currently being served.

miscConds.notes:
Total court costs are due during the term of probation. 
If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, in addition to all other enforcement sanctions available to the court, a civil judgment enforceable by all creditors' remedies shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of the governmental entities for the balance due.

Absolute Sobriety
Anger management with any follow up deemed appropiate by agent.
AODA assessment and any follow up deemed appropiate by agent.
No violent contact with Vicktorian Alcala.
Submit to DNA sample before transport to Stanley Correctional.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

State appears by Attorney Patti Wabitsch. Defendant appears in custody via video from Ozaukee County Jail with Attorney Rachel Alme-Boaz. Defendant qualifies for public defender. Counsel waives reading. Court finds probable cause. State requests $2,000 cash bail with conditions. Court orders $2000 cash bail with conditions: No contact with V.A. Counsel waives time limits. Court finds good cause to extend time limits for holding of the preliminary hearing. Status on preliminary hearing scheduled for 12-18-14 at 10:00 am.
